result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant Danielle M Bladorn in court.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Danielle M Bladorn.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court conducts colloquy on waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
State filed an information.
Defense acknowledges receipt of the information, waives further reading and enters a not guilty plea to all counts.
Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:37 AM Defendant Danielle M Bladorn appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Brandon K. Carlson in court for Danielle M Bladorn.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

The Court notes that the Defendant's appearance on Zoom is not working.
The Court will adjourn the matter to the Trial Court for the waiver of prelim waiver.
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO APPEAR IN PERSON FOR THE NEXT COURT APPEARANCE.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Zoom granted.  Atty Carlson filed within time frame.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Brandon K. Carlson
Letter of updated address for defendant, filed by Atty. Carlson

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.  Defendant is ordered to contact the Criminal Traffic Division within five (5) business days to make arrangements to sign their bond.  Failure to do so shall result in the Court issuing a bench warrant.
